channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024030403
item.description:
Report X-2024030403

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained one metal can inside. The lid of the can came open spilling its contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024030618
item.description:
Report X-2024030618

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiber board box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained one glass bottle packaged inside of a plastic bag. Inside of the box there were fiberboard dividers and styrofoam peanuts. The bottom of the glass bottle was cracked spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and will dispoed of as hazardous material.

item.title: Report X-2024030619
item.description:
Report X-2024030619

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was found during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained glass bottles separated with fiberboard dividers and the caps were secured with tape. Two of the glass bottles broke spilling inside of the fiberboard box. The contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024030467
item.description:
Report X-2024030467

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found with a red stain all over and a leakage and placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage. Once it was acknowledged that the contents inside were aerosols, the tote was transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: The majority of the package was covered in red spray paint. One of the cans inside had a puncture like damage at the bottom, most likely caused by added pressure, which resulted in a leakage. There were smaller boxes inside that contained the Ltd Qty symbol. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The leaking package was brought to the HWPA in a lined tote for processing. No other information was provided. DescribePack: The caps were loose or completely off of all four bottles in the shipment. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The carton was placed in a lined tote. PPE was worn while handling and inspecting the carton.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The leaking package was removed from sort, placed in a lined tote, and brought to the HWPA for evaluation. No other information is available. DescribePack: The caps were loose on two of the four bottles in the shipment. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined tote along with an absorbent pad. PPE was worn while handling and processing the damaged package.

item.title: Report X-2024030668
item.description:
Report X-2024030668

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a undeclared shipment was discovered. The fiberboard box contained eighteen metal can containing UN3082. Inside of the fiberboard box the metal cans were stacked two high inside of a plastic bag with closure rings. There were no DG marking or paperwork attached to the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage packaged and being held for the FAA.

item.title: Report E-2024020449
item.description:
Report E-2024020449

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: Nashville
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/20/24, at 1316 hours, personnel in the CSXT Radnor Yard discovered TILX270130, a loaded tank car of Hexamethylenediamine, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and shipper, Ascend Performance Materials, were notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-02-20-00151). Marion Environmental Inc., a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found 4 of the 4 liquid valve mounting flange bolts were less than tool tight. MEI personnel tightened the flange bolts to secure the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Tara Gardner, tgardn@ascendmaterials.com, 256-552-2528). The car was held at Radnor pending further repair and qualification by certified repair unit.

item.title: Report X-2024021623
item.description:
Report X-2024021623

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered. The fiberboard box contained sixteen glass bottles. they were packaged inside of plastic bags and had fiberboard dividers. One of the glass bottles broke spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package. A new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024030229
item.description:
Report E-2024030229

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 2-qt release of UN1263 "Spectracron comp white primer" released from (1) 55-gallon DM impacting the trailer floor, the drum had a structural failure. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who felt comfortable cleaning the release with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 85-gallon DM containing (1) 55-gallon DM of wasted product and (1) 5-gallon DF of Impacted oil dri were containerized and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
